author: allan2
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

7.2.0 has been released but PowerShell Preview in the MS Store is still on 7.2-rc.1.

### Expected behavior

```console
Preview version should be greater or equal to the stable version.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
N/A
```


### Error details

```console
N/A
```


### Environment data

```powershell
N/A
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I guess we should wait 1-2 week after release.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: PowerShell Preview and PowerShell are 2 different channels (apps) in MS Store. The former only publish preview releases, and the latter only for stable releases,

comments.author: allan2
comments.body: It just seemed odd to me that preview is behind stable, but I guess that makes sense if there's no new preview.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Yeah, a new preview will be out in December (I could be wrong on the schedule), and that will be published to the "PowerShell Preview" channel only.

comments.author: NatoBoram
comments.body:
So you guys are telling me that > A new PowerShell stable release is available: v7.2.0 > Upgrade now, or check out the release page at: > https://aka.ms/PowerShell-Release?tag=v7.2.0 is the normal and expected experience from PowerShell Preview? I've never seen a software where its "preview" channel is so disconnected from the main product that it doesn't receive stable updates. It's just fundamentally wrong -- unless you actually want to decommission the channel entirely.
GitHub
Release v7.2.0 Release of PowerShell · PowerShell/PowerShell
7.2.0 - 2021-11-08 General Cmdlet Updates and Fixes Handle exception when trying to resolve a possible link path (#16310) Tests Fix global tool and SDK tests in release pipeline (#16342) Build ...

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @NatoBoram Please open new issue with your proposal.

title: PowerShell Preview in MS Store still on 7.2-rc.1
